newsitem.title: GERMANY: Beta Systems shares slip after strong IPO.
newsitem.headline: Beta Systems shares slip after strong IPO.

text.p: Shares in German computer software group Beta Systems AG slumped about 15 percent on Tuesday after more than doubling on Monday in its first day of trade following an initial public offering.
Beta Systems shares were down 31 marks ($17.76) at 177.50 marks but off the session low of 175 marks reached in moderate volumes.
But the share remained well above the issue price of 100 marks and traders attributed the drop to profit-taking.
The broader 30-share DAX index was up 29.35 points at 3,815.12 points in midday bourse dealings.
Beta Systems shares reached a high of 215 marks on Monday, fuelled by German retail investors thirsty for a hot technology stock.
Beta, a 13-year-old developer of software for IBM Corp mainframes, issued 980,000 shares and has 147,000 more shares in reserve for a "greenshoe option" to meet additional demand.
Around 70 percent of the initial offering represented a capital increase aimed at financing foreign growth and acquisitions, especially in the United States.
Beta had 1996 sales of 56.5 million marks.
